p.p: Jetty is an open-source project providing a HTTP server, HTTP client and javax.servlet container. These 100% java components are full-featured, standards based, small foot print, embeddable, asynchronous and enterprise scalable. Jetty is dual licensed under the Apache License 2.0 and/or Eclipse Public License 1.0. Jetty is free for commercial use and distribution under the terms of either of those licenses.

Jetty is used in a wide variety of projects and products: embedded in phones; in tools like the the eclipse IDE, in frameworks like GWT, in application servers like Apache Geronimo and in huge clusters like Yahoo's Hadoop cluster. See the Jetty Powered page for more uses of Jetty.

p.b: Full commercial support, training and development services for Jetty and Jetty-based projects are available from Webtide.
